column4: Hi, I have a question regarding GRUB in Ubuntu 9.10: After adding the "elevator=noop" line in the GRUB config (I'm on a SSD) and running the update-grub command, GRUB always halts and waits for input, it's not quiet anymore. Any ideas how to make my GRUB quiet again?
grub-editenv list gives me a no command specified error (I have no idea why...)
Can you pastebin the contents of /boot/grub/grubenv?
grub-editenv list gives me a no command specified error (I have no idea why...)
Can you pastebin the contents of /boot/grub/grubenv?
For some reason /etc/init.d/grub-common isn't being run. That usually means that booting into Ubuntu failed.
oh. I'm posting from ubuntu right now
Try running "sudo service grub-common start". That should clear the recordfail from grubenv.
done. should I try a reboot now?

The idea is that /etc/init.d/grub-common is supposed to run at boot and record that Ubuntu has booted successfully. If it doesn't for whatever reason then grub assumes that the last boot failed and therefore shows you the menu to allow you to choose older kernels / rescue mode.
So if you reboot now the grub menu won't show, but the problem will come back until you figure out why /etc/init.d/grub-common isn't being run at boot.
okay, any hints where I should start searching?
thanks for your help and giving me the right directions
